introduction.p: There are several useful formulas for simplifying polynomials.

statement.p: If a=2y and b=-3z^2, find b^3 and 3a^2b.

solution.p: We substitute 2y for a and -3z^2 for b to find b^3 \amp =(\blert{-3z^2})^3 = (-3)^3(z^2)^3 = -27z^6 3a^2b \amp = 3 (\blert{2y})^2(\blert{-3z^2}) = 3(4y^2)(-3z^2)=-36y^2z^2

introduction.p: Sometimes it is easier to use formulas to square binomials.

solution.p: We substitute 3h^2 for a and 4k^3 for b into the identity. (3h^2+4k^3)^2 \amp =(3h^2)^2 +2(3h^2)(4k^3) +(4k^3)^2 \amp = 9h^4+24h^2k^3+16k^6
We substitute 2xy^2 for a and 5 for b into the identity. (2xy^2-5)^2 \amp =(2xy^2)^2 -2(2xy^2)(5) +5^2 \amp = 4x^2y^4 - 20xy^2+25
